member.name: M:Vector.XlApi.Xl.CreateDriverConfig
member.summary:
This function allocates a structure that holds information on the hardware configuration.
The application may call this function any time. The returned structure holds the state of the driver configuration at the time of the call. An application may hold multiple instances of at the same time. Once the application does not need an instance anymore, it must release the instance with .
In contrast to the native function that lets the application select the version of the driver config, the wrapper always requests . Therefore, this function will fail if the native DLL is too old to support the requested version.
member.returns: A structure that holds information on the hardware configuration.
member.exception: General error, e.g. native DLL is too old.

member.name: M:Vector.XlApi.Xl.NetAddVirtualPort(Vector.XlApi.XlNetworkHandle,System.String,System.String,Vector.XlApi.XlRxHandle)
member.summary: Adds a temporary virtual port to a switch segment with the given switch name on the network, specified by the networkHandle.
member.remarks: The port name must be unique in the network. The port will not be persisted in the device configuration. The port will be added and immediately opened - no further function call is necessary. The port is closed automatically with the function call.
member.param: Handle of network to open the port on.
Name of the switch segment to add the virtual port on.
Application assigned name of the virtual port to add. Must be unique in the network.
Application specific handle to identify the different events received.
member.returns: Handle of the opened temporary virtual port.
member.exception: General error, e.g. name of switch not found in network.

member.name: M:Vector.XlApi.Xl.TryNetRequestMACAddress(Vector.XlApi.XlNetworkHandle,Vector.XlApi.XlEthMacAddress@)
member.summary:
Request and lock a globally unique ETH MAC address from pool of application-reservable MAC addresses in the network.
The pool of the network is the union of all the MAC-pools of the devices that are part of the network. When the networkHandle is closed - or when the application terminates - the MAC address is implicitly released. While a MAC address is locked, no other application can request the address.
member.param: Handle of the network to query for a MAC address.
On success: the reserved MAC address, otherwise undefined.
member.returns:
Status returned by native library.
: Reservation of MAC succeeded.
: The pool of on-demand allocatable MAC addresses of all devices in the network is exhausted.
: No device in the network has a pool of demand-allocatable MAC addresses

member.name: M:Vector.XlApi.Xl.NetRequestMACAddress(Vector.XlApi.XlNetworkHandle)
member.summary: Request and lock a globally unique ETH MAC address from pool of application-reservable MAC addresses in the network.
member.remarks: The pool of the network is the union of all the MAC-pools of the devices that are part of the network. When the networkHandle is closed - or when the application terminates - the MAC address is implicitly released. While a MAC address is locked, no other application can request the address.
member.param: Handle of the network to query for a MAC address.
member.returns: The reserved Mac address.
member.exception: General error, e.g. MAC address pool is exhausted.

member.name: M:Vector.XlApi.Xl.NetReleaseMACAddress(Vector.XlApi.XlNetworkHandle,Vector.XlApi.XlEthMacAddress)
member.summary: Release a former requested ETH MAC address from the pool of all application-reservable MAC addresses in the network.
member.param: Handle of the network that was allocated from.
MAC address to return to the pool.
member.exception: General error, e.g. MAC address has not been allocated.

member.name: M:Vector.XlApi.Xl.NetSetNotification(Vector.XlApi.XlNetworkHandle,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Set the queue level for notifications on the receive queue of the given network and return a duplicate of the native libraries notification handle as an .
The application should call on the returned event object, after , as the closed network does not signal the event anymore.
For each event written, the driver signals the event if the resulting receive queue level (in bytes) is larger or equal to the queue level set by this function. The application may wait for the event with or .
Windows events have a signaled and a non-signaled state but are not counting. or block the calling thread until the Windows event reaches the signaled state and reset the event to the non-signaled state when the thread execution continues. Multiple driver events might have been inserted before the Windows event was reset. To ensure that all incoming driver events are eventually processed, the thread must consequently call in a loop until it returns before waiting again.
Applications should only call this function once after opening the network.
member.param: Handle of the network to set the queue level on.
Specifies the number of bytes that triggers the event. '1' is the recommended value.
member.returns: Duplicate of the Windows event handle wrapped as a .
member.exception: General error, e.g. invalid network handle.

member.name: M:Vector.XlApi.Xl.NetEthOpenNetwork(System.String,System.String,Vector.XlApi.XlAccessType,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Opens the network with the specified name and creates a receive network queue.
member.param: Name of the network to be opened. Available names can be retrieved by .
Optional application name that opens the network.
Defines if the network data will be transmitted reliable or (in future) unreliable for the corresponding uplink.
Receive queue size in bytes. Value should be between and .
member.returns: Handle to the opened network.
member.exception: General error, e.g. no network of given name exists.

member.name: M:Vector.XlApi.Xl.TryNetEthReceive(Vector.XlApi.XlNetworkHandle,Vector.XlApi.XlNetEthEvent,System.UInt32@,Vector.XlApi.XlRxHandle[])
member.summary:
Try to retrieve one event from the receive event queue on a network.
The event has two components: the event buffer itself and an array of application specified values that define the set of measurement points or virtual ports that returned event applies to.
member.param: Handle to the network to read the event from.
Buffer for a single ethernet event.
Number of valid entries returned in
Buffer to receive the rxHandles of the event. Its array length should at least be as large as the number of MPs and VPs opened on the network.
member.returns: Status code returned by the native library, e.g. if the receive queue is empty.
member.exception: The rxHandles array is null or has length 0.

member.name: M:Vector.XlApi.Xl.NetEthReceive(Vector.XlApi.XlNetworkHandle,Vector.XlApi.XlNetEthEvent,System.UInt32@,Vector.XlApi.XlRxHandle[])
member.summary:
Retrieves one event from the receive event queue on a network.
The event has two components: the event buffer itself and an array of application specified values that define the set of measurement points or virtual ports that returned event applies to.
member.param: Handle to the network to read the event from.
Buffer for a single ethernet event.
Number of valid entries returned in
Buffer to receive the rxHandles of the event. Its array length should at least be as large as the number of MPs and VPs opened on the network.
member.exception: General error, e.g. receive queue is empty.
The rxHandles array is null or has length 0.

member.name: T:Vector.XlApi.XlIchannelDrvConfig
member.summary: This structure contains information on a channel of a local or remote connected device.
member.remarks: All channels, that are directly connected to the host, are local channels. The sub devices of a remote host, for example a VN8900 device, have remote channels and local channel counterparts. A remote channel is a channel from the perspective of the remote host. Its local channel counterpart is the same channel but from perspective of the host PC.

member.name: P:Vector.XlApi.XlIchannelDrvConfig.channelIndex
member.summary: Index of the local channel in the channel list returned by .
member.remarks: This index uniquely identifies a local channel in the current application. Remote channels have the same channelIndex than their local counterpart. The channel Mask can be computed as (XLaccess)1 << channelIndex.

member.name: T:Vector.XlApi.XlIdriverConfig
member.summary:
Encapsulates the native representation of the CreateDriverConfig-structure and provides a managed representation of its data.
The application should this object to free the native memory after it has extracted all relevant data using the Getter-Methods (e.g. , ). The Getter-Methods translate the native objects into a managed representation and preserve reference identity. This means that if two pointers in the native representation point to the same object, the two corresponding pointers in the managed representation also point to the same object, as determined by .

The wrapper does not expose any method that expects this handle.

member.name: M:Vector.XlApi.XlIdriverConfig.Dispose
member.summary:
Release the native part of the driver config with xlDestroyDriverConfig().
Afterwards, no methods on this object may be called anymore, but any managed object returned by the methods of this object remains valid.
